name: France
note: Note: using PEC hist data to calculate the 1990 target of 40% wrt 2010. https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/ener/files/documents/fr_final_necp_main_en.pdf, at p. 318.
label: 40% below 1990

name: Germany
note: Note: using PEC hist data to calculate the 1990 target of 65% wrt 2010. Federal Ministry of Justice and Consumer Protection, Federal Climate Change Act (2021) https://www.gesetze-im-internet.de/englisch_ksg/englisch_ksg.html#p0028, at sections 3 and 3a.
label: 65% below 1990

name: Czech Republic
note: Note: 30% below 2005, that is 48% below 1990 excl.LULUCF https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/ener/files/documents/cs_final_necp_main_en.pdf at p.12; https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/ener/files/documents/cs_final_necp_main_en.pdf
label: 30% below 2005

name: Denmark
note: Note: 70% reduction to 1990 incl. LULUCF but no specification on LULUCF amount
label: 70% below 1990

name: Greece
note: Note: 42% relative to 1990 levels,211 excluding LULUCF emissions. https://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/sites/ff34a34b-en/index.html?itemId=/content/component/ff34a34b-en, at section 4.3.2.
label: 42% below 1990

name: Hungary
note: Note: 40% compared to 1990 levels by 2030”.214 Hungary’s NECP does not specify whether the target includes LULUCF emissions or not, but it compares this target to emissions projections excluding LULUCF. https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/default/files/documents/hu_final_necp_main_en.pdf, at p. 158.
label: 40% below 1990

name: Ireland
note: Notes: Using PRIMAPHIST, 2018 emissions ~2010. “a 51% reduction on 2018 levels of emissions by 2030” as the 2030 target contained in its Climate Action and Low Carbon Development (Amendment) Bill 2021.217 This Bill has since been enacted.218 This target includes LULUCF emissions and, in calculating the first carbon budgets under the Climate Action and Low Carbon Development Act, Ireland’s Climate Change Advisory Council “has assumed a 51% emissions reduction in the LULUCF sector in the period to 2030”,219 i.e. that the target applies to LULUCF emissions and non-LULUCF emissions equally. 218 See the Climate Action and Low Carbon Development (Amendment) Act 2021 https://www.irishstatutebook.ie/eli/2021/act/32/enacted/en/html. 219 Climate Change Advisory Council, Carbon Budget Technical Report (October 2021) https://www.climatecouncil.ie/media/climatechangeadvisorycouncil/Technical%20report%20on%20carbon%20budgets%2025.10.2021.pdf, at p. 6.
label: 51% below 2018

name: Latvia
note: Note: 65% relative to 1990 levels, excluding LULUCF. 65% relative to 1990 levels, excluding LULUCF
label: 65% below 1990

name: Lithuania
note: Note: 1990 by 70 per cent by 2030. incl LULUCF. Parliament of Lithuania, Ruling on the adoption of a national climate change agenda (2021), https://e-seimas.lrs.lt/portal/legalAct/lt/TAP/ba67ae20d5a111eb866fe2e083228059?positionInSearchResults=1&searchModelUUID=ac1a49e8-1f4f-4dc6-b6ed-aefce7872e19
label: 70% below 1990

name: The Netherlands
note: Note: 49% below 1990. Planbureau voor de Leefomgeving, Analyse Regeerakkoord Rutte-III: Effecten Op Klimaat En Energie (2017) https://www.pbl.nl/sites/default/files/downloads/pbl-2017-analyse-regeerakkoord-rutte-III-effecten-op-klimaat-en-energie_3009.pdf, at p. 7.
label: 49% below 1990

name: Portugal
note: Note: from -45% to - 55% in 2030…compared to 2005 levels. Government of Portugal, National Energy and Climate Plan 2021-2030 (2019) https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/default/files/documents/pt_final_necp_main_en.pdf, at p. 31.
label: 45% to 55% below 2005

name: Spain
note: Note: 23% below 1990. Government of Spain, Integrated National Energy and Climate Plan 2021-2030 (2020) https://ec.europa.eu/energy/sites/default/files/documents/es_final_necp_main_en.pdf, at p. 114;
label: 23% below 1990
